description.narrative: The Fund is expected to have a strong impact for private sector development as follows: -- Private sector development: The Fund will add value to its investee companies, by providing managerial, operational and strategic support to improve their competitiveness and sustainability -- Economic development: The Fund is expected to invest in high-growth companies aiming to increase output, which in turn should lead to increased employment rates. -- Environmental practices: The Fund Manager will adopt international best practices for environmental and social risk assessment and management, and improve transparency and corporate governance, thus transferring knowledge and skills to portfolio companies. -- Support of SMEs: The Fund is expected to invest in SMEs and companies slightly above the SME scope.

The Project consists of an IFC equity investment of up to $15 million in India Knowledge-Manufacturing Company (IKMC or the Fund) or a maximum of 20% of total combined capital commitments in IKMC and all parallel entities. With a target size of $150 million including commitments from parallel entities, the Fund is expected to invest in about eight to 10 primarily unlisted small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and mid-cap companies in India. The Fund will focus on underserved sectors with high growth rates --such as healthcare, information and communication technology, engineering (including related manufacturing and services), and clean technology. Some investments are expected to be made into companies located in Tier II and Tier III cities, thus creating jobs and driving growth and demand in these cities. IKMC will invest through Forum Synergies India Trust (the Trust), a venture capital fund registered with the Securities and Exchange Board of India. The Trust will be managed by Forum Synergies (India) PE Fund Managers Pvt. Ltd. (Forum Synergies or the Fund Manager), a well qualified first-time fund management team based in Bangalore, India. The Fund Manager will use its strong operating experience and skills to bring high standards of corporate governance to portfolio companies, thus contributing towards the transformation and industry growth in these sectors.

name.narrative: The Fund is a limited duration company registered under the laws of Mauritius. The Trust, through which the Fund will invest in India, is a venture capital fund registered under the laws of India. Forum Synergies, a local investment team headquartered in Bangalore, India, will operate and seek investment opportunities across India. Local Indian investors will participate through a parallel vehicle called India Knowledge-Manufacturing Fund - I (IKMF-I), a scheme of the Trust established in India, to which Forum Synergies serves as the investment manager. Through its relationship with Axon Capital, a Madrid-based venture and PE fund manager, the Fund Manager will also have access to India Opportunities Fund F.C.R., a parallel vehicle primarily for European investors cultivated under the Axon relationship. This parallel vehicle is to invest pro-rata, along with IKMF-I, into the same set of portfolio companies.
